WorkItem.ClosedComment:
This is addressed and tests added in commit 21b7c9ca0c829.  

Note that the last issue is actually valid syntax, but will be a run-time error (function calls - which a constructor is - can return a reference type, though none do.  See http://es5.github.com/#x8.7 .  The grammar also permits it).

Comments.Message: This is exactly the correct behaviour. If you want to avoid this from occurring, you'll need to end the line with a semi-colon. It's unclear what the expectation of this code isâ€”|new| is an operator, but you're not providing it with a NewExpression on the right.

Hi, the expectation of this code is for the TypeScript compiler to generate an error.

Because I did not write this.greeting()  //Please don't put brackets where I did not intend them

I hope that makes sense?
Sorry about the curlies, I thought wiki formatting was finally working.
rwaldron is correct, this is syntactically valid but probably should be giving an error during the assignment. Following up to see if we want to categorize 'new' expressions as values.
@nablog yeah that's not valid anywhere and appears to be a naive compilation issue
Marked as active, we're going to look into this issue.
